title: The Tragedy of Titus Andronicus
location: Before the Senate House and a tomb, Rome, Italy
scene_summary: Saturninus and Bassianus, sons of the late Emperor, vie for the throne. Titus Andronicus, a Roman general, returns from war against the Goths, bringing Queen Tamora, her sons, and Aaron the Moor as captives. Titus sacrifices Tamora's son Alarbus, despite her pleas, sparking her vengeance. Emperor Saturninus is chosen, and he claims Titus's daughter Lavinia, betrothed to Bassianus. Titus kills his son Mutius for defending Bassianus, who elopes with Lavinia. Saturninus, spurned, weds Tamora, who plots with Aaron to destroy Titus's family, setting up the cycle of revenge.

title: The Tragedy of Titus Andronicus
location: A room in the Emperor's palace, Rome, Italy
scene_summary: Aaron, Tamora's lover, revels in her rise as Empress, plotting chaos. Tamora's sons, Chiron and Demetrius, lust for Lavinia. Aaron advises them to rape her in the forest during a hunt, manipulating their desires to ruin Titus, deepening the vengeful conspiracy.

title: The Tragedy of Titus Andronicus
scene_summary: Titus, Saturninus, Tamora, and others prepare for a hunt. Titus's sons, Martius and Quintus, join, while Aaron plans Lavinia's assault. The festive mood contrasts the impending violence, setting the stage for Tamora's trap.

title: The Tragedy of Titus Andronicus
location: A lonely part of the forest, Rome, Italy
scene_summary: Aaron buries gold, framing Titus's sons. Tamora meets Aaron, urging lust, but he focuses on revenge. Chiron and Demetrius kill Bassianus, rape and mutilate Lavinia, cutting her tongue and hands. Aaron lures Martius and Quintus into a pit with Bassianus's body, framing them for murder. Saturninus arrests them, and Tamora feigns sympathy, escalating Titus's losses.

title: The Tragedy of Titus Andronicus
location: Another part of the forest, Rome, Italy
scene_summary: Marcus, Titus's brother, finds Lavinia, mutilated and mute, and laments her suffering. He takes her to Titus, her condition symbolizing Rome's decay and setting up Titus's quest for justice.

title: The Tragedy of Titus Andronicus
scene_summary: Titus pleads for his sons, Martius and Quintus, as they're led to execution, but the Tribune ignores him. Aaron falsely claims Saturninus will spare them if Titus, Marcus, or Lucius cuts off a hand. Titus sacrifices his hand, but Aaron sends it back with his sons' heads. Titus, Lavinia, and Lucius vow revenge, and Titus sends Lucius to raise an army with the Goths, marking his shift to vengeance.

title: The Tragedy of Titus Andronicus
location: A room in Titus's house, Rome, Italy
scene_summary: Titus, Marcus, Lavinia, and Young Lucius dine, grieving. Titus, unhinged, interprets Lavinia's gestures, vowing to uncover her rapists. He feeds Lavinia, showing care amidst madness, and plans retribution, deepening the tragic pathos.

title: The Tragedy of Titus Andronicus
scene_summary: Lavinia, using a stick, reveals Chiron and Demetrius as her rapists by writing in the sand. Titus, Marcus, and Young Lucius swear to punish Tamora's sons, and Titus devises a plan, feigning madness to lure his enemies, advancing his revenge plot.

title: The Tragedy of Titus Andronicus
location: A room in the Emperor's palace, Rome, Italy
scene_summary: Titus sends Young Lucius with weapons and a cryptic message to Chiron and Demetrius, who dismiss it, unaware of his intent. Aaron recognizes Titus's sanity, but Tamora plans to exploit his “madness.” A Nurse reveals Tamora's newborn by Aaron, and Aaron kills her to protect the secret, vowing to save his child, showing his loyalty to his own blood.

title: The Tragedy of Titus Andronicus
location: A public place in Rome, Italy
scene_summary: Titus, feigning madness, shoots arrows with petitions to the gods, seeking justice, alarming Marcus and Publius. A Clown delivers a letter to Saturninus, unknowingly aiding Titus, who uses the ruse to draw Tamora into his trap, blending absurdity with strategy.

title: The Tragedy of Titus Andronicus
location: A room in the Emperor's palace, Rome, Italy
scene_summary: Saturninus, enraged by Titus's arrows and the Clown's letter, orders the Clown's execution. News of Lucius's Gothic army alarms him. Tamora, confident, plans to visit Titus, posing as Revenge to deceive him, underestimating his cunning, setting up the climactic confrontation.

title: The Tragedy of Titus Andronicus
scene_summary: Lucius, with the Goths, captures Aaron and his child. Aaron confesses his crimes, including Lavinia's rape and Titus's sons' framing, to save his son. Lucius vows justice. A Goth brings Tamora's sons, and Lucius prepares to confront Saturninus, aligning with Titus's revenge.

title: The Tragedy of Titus Andronicus
location: A courtyard in Titus's house, Rome, Italy
scene_summary: Tamora, as Revenge, with Chiron and Demetrius as Rape and Murder, visits Titus, urging him to summon Lucius. Titus, feigning compliance, captures her sons, kills them, and plans to bake them into pies for a banquet, revealing his deadly cunning and Tamora's miscalculation.

title: The Tragedy of Titus Andronicus
location: A banqueting room in Titus's house, Rome, Italy
scene_summary: Titus hosts Saturninus, Tamora, and Lucius, serving pies made from Chiron and Demetrius. He reveals Lavinia's rape, kills her to end her shame, then stabs Tamora. Saturninus kills Titus, and Lucius kills Saturninus. Lucius recounts Titus's wrongs, is proclaimed Emperor, and sentences Aaron to a torturous death. Marcus and the Romans mourn, restoring order, ending the bloody cycle with Lucius's rule.
